head.supplied: Melbourne bot Garden ¶ 16/6/73. ¶ ¶ Accept my best thanks, dear Dr Hector, for sending me through Mr Gore the new volume, which reflects great credit on your administration and on the zeal of your co...

div.p: Folder 3, box 59, James Hector, correspondence received, Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa Archives, Wellington.

Accept my best thanks, dear Dr Hector, for sending me through Mr Gore the new volume, which reflects great credit on your administration and on the zeal of your cooperators. I have placed it in the Library of my museum; that I could not absolve fully yet my obligations, concerning the Chatham Island plants you will understand, when you reflect how I had to "struggle for existence" for the last year and more. When I get peace, I will give my attention to them.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: How far have you got my fragmenta. I will endeavour to complete your set
